metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: SVG has some predefined shape elements that can be used by developers:
content.html: SVG has some predefined shape elements that can be used by developers:

content.text: The following chapters will explain each element, starting with the <rect> element.
content.html: The following chapters will explain each element, starting with the <rect> element.

content.text: The <rect> element is used to create a rectangle and variations of a rectangle shape.
content.html: The <rect> element is used to create a rectangle and variations of a rectangle shape.

content.text: The <rect> element has six basic attributes to position and shape the rectangle:
content.html: The <rect> element has six basic attributes to position and shape the rectangle:

content.code_html:
Attribute Description
width Required. The width of the rectangle
height Required. The height of the rectangle
x The x-position for the top-left corner of the rectangle
y The y-position for the top-left corner of the rectangle
rx The x radius of the corners of the rectangle (used to round the corners). Default is 0
ry The y radius of the corners of the rectangle (used to round the corners). Default is 0

content.text: This example creates a rectangle with the six basic attributes and a fill color:
content.html: This example creates a rectangle with the six basic attributes and a fill color:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect 
  width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" />
width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" /

content.code:
<svg width="300" height="130" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect 
width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" />

</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<rect 
  width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" />
width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" /

content.code_html:
<svg width="300" height="130" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" />
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<rect 
  width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" />
width="200" height="100" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20" fill="blue" /

content.text: Let's look at another example that contains some new attributes:
content.html: Let's look at another example that contains some new attributes:

content.code:
<svg width="320" height="130" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">


<rect width="300" height="100"
x="10" y="10" style="fill:rgb(0,0,255);stroke-width:3;stroke:red" />

</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="320" height="130" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect width="300" height="100" x="10" y="10" style="fill:rgb(0,0,255);stroke-width:3;stroke:red" />
</svg>

content.text: Let's look at another example that contains some new attributes:
content.html: Let's look at another example that contains some new attributes:

content.code:
<svg width="300" height="170" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">


<rect width="150" height="150" x="10" y="10" 

style="fill:blue;stroke:pink;stroke-width:5;fill-opacity:0.1;stroke-opacity:0.9" />

</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="300" height="170" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect width="150" height="150" x="10" y="10"
  style="fill:blue;stroke:pink;stroke-width:5;fill-opacity:0.1;stroke-opacity:0.9" />
</svg>

content.text: Define the opacity for the whole element:
content.html: Define the opacity for the whole element:

content.code:
<svg width="300" height="170" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">


<rect width="150" height="150" x="10" y="10"

style="fill:blue;stroke:pink;stroke-width:5;opacity:0.5" />

</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="300" height="170" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect width="150" height="150" x="10" y="10"
  style="fill:blue;stroke:pink;stroke-width:5;opacity:0.5" />
</svg>

content.text: Last example, create a rectangle with rounded corners:
content.html: Last example, create a rectangle with rounded corners:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect width="150"
height="150" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20"
  style="fill:red;stroke:black;stroke-width:5;opacity:0.5" />

width="150"
height="150" x="10" y="10" rx="20" ry="20"
  style="fill:red;stroke:black;stroke-width:5;opacity:0.5" /
